data.title: Robert Celestin, Esq.
data.meta_description: Check out what Robert Celestin, Esq. will be attending at ASCAP EXPO
data.text:
About me

Mr. Robert A. Celestin, Esq. has practiced entertainment law in New York for over 25 years. A graduate of Yale University and Columbia Law School; Mr. Celestin started his legal career as an Associate at Kaye, Scholer, Fierman, Hays & Handler. He then went on to work in the legal department of Arista Records before becoming the VP/GM of Uptown Records, Inc., the label responsible for the careers of Mary J. Blige, Jodeci, Guy and others and worked alongside Sean “P-Diddy” Combs. He later went on to work for Untouchables Entertainment, Inc., as VP/GM and was instrumental in the success of Pete Rock and CL Smooth, Intro and Donnell Jones. Mr. Celestin then went on to work with his mentor Louise West, Esq. in representing Timbaland, Missy Elliot and Ginuwine. Mr. Celestin also managed the platinum selling group City High and presently provides consultation to up and coming music artists, artist managers and independent record labels in the areas of online marketing, social media setup and implementation, artist development and production services through his production company - Intelligent Music Entertainment, Inc. Presently, Mr. Celestin’s law firm represents independent labels, artists, producers, songwriters, as well as major artists such as Secondhand Serenade, The Clipse, Pusha T, Mickey Factz, Petey Pablo, celebreality stars Toccara and Laurieann Gibson, super manager Blue Williams and old school legends like Marley Marl, Funkmaster Flex and Uncle Ralph McDaniels, among others.
